title.rendered: AMI Named Accredited Quality Contractor for 2021

content.rendered:
Architectural Metals Inc. has been recognized by Associated Builders and Contractor members, Inc.
(ABC) as a 2021 Accredited Quality Contractor (AQC). AQC members proudly set the construction industry
standard as highly performing, ethical contractors and members of their communities. AQC
status is determined by a stringent and thorough set of criteria that demonstrate commitment to five
key areas of corporate responsibility: quality, safety, talent management, craft and management
education, and community relations.

AQC members are guided by the principles of free enterprise, along with other ABC members, and
believe construction contracts should be awarded based on sound and credible criteria, such as those
demonstrated by AQC, regardless of labor affiliation. Architectural Metals Inc. is committed to delivering
its clients high quality services while providing their employees the freedom to work, grow and prosper
without the restraints of forced union membership and project labor agreements.

Sincerely,

Michael D. Bellaman, President & CEO
Associated Builders and Contractors, Inc.

Associated Builders and Contractors (ABC) is a national construction industry trade association
established in 1950 that represents nearly 21,000 chapter members. Founded on the merit shop
philosophy, ABC and its 69 chapters help members develop people, win work and deliver that work
safely, ethically and profitably for the betterment of the communities in which ABC and its members
work. Visit us at abc.org.
Accreditation as an Accredited Quality Contractor does not constitute a guarantee or warranty by ABC of
any specific level of services performed or products provided by the contractor to any third party.
